items.q: Which artist had a massive hit in 2020 with the song 'Blinding Lights'?
items.explanation: The synth-heavy track dominated the Billboard charts globally.

items.q: Superman's primary weakness is a green radioactive rock from his home planet called Kryptonite.
items.explanation: Exposure to green Kryptonite drains his powers and causes him intense pain.

items.q: The first video game ever created was Super Mario Bros.
items.explanation: Games like 'Tennis for Two' or 'Pong' predated Mario by decades.

items.q: What is the name of the fictional, magical boarding school setting of the Harry Potter books?
items.a: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
items.explanation: The castle is located in the Scottish Highlands.

items.q: What 1985 movie features a time-traveling DeLorean car?
items.explanation: It stars Michael J. Fox as Marty McFly and Christopher Lloyd as Doc Brown.

items.q: Who is the 'Princess of Pop' known for hits like 'Toxic' and '...Baby One More Time'?
items.explanation: She was one of the driving forces behind the teen pop revival in the late 1990s.

items.q: In the DC Universe, what superhero operates out of the bat-filled city of Gotham?
items.explanation: Billionaire Bruce Wayne fights crime as Batman to avenge his parents' murder.

items.q: What is the name of the coffee shop where the main characters frequently hang out in 'Friends'?
items.explanation: Gunther is the iconic manager of the fictional Greenwich Village coffee house.

items.q: Which famous rapper is married to Beyonc√© and famously ran Roc-A-Fella Records?
items.explanation: He is one of the most critically and commercially successful rappers of all time.

items.q: What is the term for a passionately devoted fanbase of a singer or media franchise, like 'Swifties' or 'Directioners'?
items.explanation: The term 'stan' originated from the Eminem song of the same name.
